intro: Terminalia morobensis, commonly known as the Morobe terminalia, is a tropical tree native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elliptical leaves with a glossy upper surface. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in lowland and hill forest environments, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
